p: Various microbiology identification tools were used across the studies ( Fig. 3 ). Basic microbiology identification tools including the spot test and biochemical test were used in 61% of the studies (n = 34). Twenty studies used the same basic microbiology identification tools with the addition of more sophisticated tools: PCR (n = 1); API Identification System (n = 6); VITEK 2 system (n = 6); bile esculin test, TSI and IMViC test, and oxidative-fermentation test (n = 1); API Identification System, RAPD-PCR, and 16S-rRNA sequencing (n = 1); PCR of 16S-rRNA gene (n = 1), schema of Cheesbrough and Cowan (n = 1); API Identification System, and 16S-rRNA sequencing (n = 1); and whole-genome sequencing (n = 1).
